page.title: 03TEWIN HILL FARM
page.content: There has been a farm at Tewin Hill for 450 years. The present tenant, Mr Davies has been farming the 550 acres for 17 years, but the owner is selling up so he will soon have to move to another farm. He has 150 cows ranging from 4 week old calves up to cows of 2 years old on the farm. He uses an electric fence to control the grazing areas, which cost Â£1,000. He employs a man to do the milking who has to get up at 5 am. Mr Davies gets up between 6 and 7 am. and is never in bed before midnight. The harvest is the busiest time of the year, when they can be up until 1 or 2 in the morning. We saw the combine harvester which cost Â£45,000. The farm also has beehives and a goldfish pond. The farmer has a 7 year old labrador as a pet. {SUSAN BREWSTER ELIZABETH CREMER
